headline: In Ohio Republican Senate debate, candidates draw sharper distinctions
author: Nick Evans

The following article was originally published in the Ohio Capital Journal and published on News5Cleveland.com under a content-sharing agreement.
In the race’s first statewide televised debate, the five leading Ohio Republican U.S. Senate candidates sparred over a handful of major issues.
Vance again criticized Mandel for using his time in the Marines as a “political football.” Former GOP chair Timken called it an embarrassment.
Gibbons, meanwhile, insisted his point about Mandel’s lack of private sector experience wasn’t meant to denigrate his military service.
